com.geekabyte.jprowork

Class Member

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.geekabyte.jprowork.Member

  • public class Member
extends java.lang.Object
    The Java object representation of a user on Prowork.

      • getProjectActivities

        public java.util.List<Activity> getProjectActivities(int projectId,
                                            int read)
                                              throws JproworkRuntimeException
        Method to get a list of project activities.
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of project whose activities is to retrieved
        read - Optional. By default, only unread activity messages are returned. To include read messages, set this parameter to 1
        Returns:
        List A list of Prowork Activity objects
        Throws:
        JproworkRuntimeException - if an error occurs while retrieving projects Activities.
        See Also:
        Activity

      • getProjectActivities

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

        See Also:
        Activity

      • getAllProjectActivities

        public java.util.List<Activity> getAllProjectActivities()
                                                 throws JproworkRuntimeException
        Get the activity stream of all projects the authenticated user is a member of. Note that this resets the notification count to zero. By default the method pulls only unread notifications. To retrieve read notifications as well, add the read query parameter.
        Returns:
        A list of Prowork Activity object
        Throws:
        JproworkRuntimeException
        See Also:
        Activity

      • getAllProjectActivities

        public java.util.List<Activity> getAllProjectActivities(int read)
                                                 throws JproworkRuntimeException
        Get the activity stream of all projects the authenticated user is a member of. Note that this resets the notification count to zero. By default the method pulls only unread notifications. To retrieve read notifications as well, add the read query parameter.
        Parameters:
        read - flag that determines whether to return read notifications. 1 means fetch
        Returns:
        list of Prowork Activity Object
        Throws:
        JproworkRuntimeException
        See Also:
        Activity

      • getNotificationCount

        public int getNotificationCount()
                         throws JproworkRuntimeException
        Get the activity stream notification count for this user.
        Returns:
        The number of notification count for this user
        Throws:
        JproworkRuntimeException
